DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Increasing knowledge complementary alternative medicine practice use woman increase risk breast cancer may provide useful information plan breast-cancer-prevention strategy . PURPOSE : Clinical trial determine many woman increase risk breast cancer use complementary alternative medicine .
DOC.brief_title: Complementary Alternative Medicine Practices Used Women Increased Risk Breast Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine prevalence complementary alternative medicine ( CAM ) practice among adult woman enrol Risk Assessment Clinic National Naval Medical Center Breast Care Center find increase risk develop breast cancer . II . Correlate use CAM individual risk breast cancer . III . Define type CAM practice use study population . IV . Identify reason study population use CAM . OUTLINE : Patients stratify accord prevalence complementary alternative medicine practice ( enteral/parenteral v psychologic/neurologic ) . Patients complete Personal Risk Assessment form , pre-test/post-test knowledge questionnaire , survey questionnaire . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 102 patient accrue study within approximately 2 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Enrolled Risk Assessment Clinic ( RAC ) National Naval Medical Center find increase risk breast cancer base least one following : Estimated risk least 1.7 % develop breast cancer next 5 year , determine Breast Cancer Risk Assessment Tool ( BCRAT ) Prior history lobular carcinoma situ ductal carcinoma situ Family history breast ovarian cancer consistent autosomal dominant pattern inheritance empirically elevate risk breast cancer base single first seconddegree relative breast ovarian cancer Must attend RAC education session within past 36 month Hormone receptor status : Not specify PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 Sex : Female Menopausal status : Not specify Performance status : Not specify Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : No prior cancer except ductal carcinoma situ basal cell carcinoma Able read understand English PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Not specify
